posts.post_content: I love this cat, it reminds me of [hearthfire hobgoblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hearthfire hobgoblin) but with enough toughness for double strike to be relevant in creature fights. For added face smashing, staple a [colossal might](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=colossal might) on this guy...fun!

posts.post_content: Give the kittys a [Scourge of the Nobilis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scourge of the Nobilis). 4/6, double strike, firebreathing, lifelink. Even better if you have a [Bramblewood Paragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bramblewood Paragon) and an [Obsidian Battle-Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Obsidian Battle-Axe) in play. Comes into play a 5/6 doublestriking, trampling, hasted cat warrior, becomes a 7/8 doublestriking, firebreathing, trampling, lifelinking vicious kitty.
posts.html:
Give the kittys a Scourge of the Nobilis. 4/6, double strike, firebreathing, lifelink. Even better if you have a Bramblewood Paragon and an Obsidian Battle-Axe in play. Comes into play a 5/6 doublestriking, trampling, hasted cat warrior, becomes a 7/8 doublestriking, firebreathing, trampling, lifelinking vicious kitty.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: A3Kitsune (2/6/2010 5:12:05 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Technically, you have to consider both sides of what it is and can do.. for one thing your not likely to be able to play a behemoth sledge on this easily, as it takes 6 mana to put out and attach in one turn, unless your willing to leave it on the field first before attaching it, and that 6 mana could just as easily provide you with another big creature instead. The twin claws are a 4 cmc creature with a 2/4 double strike, where as a thoctar is a 5/4 for 3 cmc in the same colors, so I'd have to say thoctar wins here. I'd rather have a thoctar on the field, and enchant it with a runes of the deus, than try to get marisi twin claws in play, keep it alive, then fish out a behemoth sledge and have to play it for 6, after which it's still vulnerable to removal.
posts.html:
Technically, you have to consider both sides of what it is and can do.. for one thing your not likely to be able to play a behemoth sledge on this easily, as it takes 6 mana to put out and attach in one turn, unless your willing to leave it on the field first before attaching it, and that 6 mana could just as easily provide you with another big creature instead. The twin claws are a 4 cmc creature with a 2/4 double strike, where as a thoctar is a 5/4 for 3 cmc in the same colors, so I'd have to say thoctar wins here. I'd rather have a thoctar on the field, and enchant it with a runes of the deus, than try to get marisi twin claws in play, keep it alive, then fish out a behemoth sledge and have to play it for 6, after which it's still vulnerable to removal.
